title: Wall Street Breakfast April 29: Amazon Slides After Weaker-Than-Anticipated Sales Forecast
author: Seeking Alpha
dc:creator: Seeking Alpha
description: Amazon fell sharply in after-hours trading after reporting operating income below expectations for Q1 and setting cautious guidance for Q2. Apple's Chief Executive Tim Cook said the tech giant was "not immune" to the challenges caused by the war in Ukraine and Covid-related disruptions in China. Germany drops opposition to the Russian oil embargo. Catch today’s WSB article here.
